Event: Experiencing anxiety and depression, including negative thoughts and feelings of insecurity, lack of confidence, and suicidal thoughts.
Post: "Lost in a sea of negativity, I'm drowning in my own anxiety and depression. It's like my mind is a battlefield, and I'm constantly fighting a losing war against my inner demons. The voices in my head tell me I'm not good enough, that I'll never be good enough, and it's hard to argue with them when every step forward feels like a struggle. It's suffocating, feeling like I'm trapped in this never-ending cycle of self-doubt and fear. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just broken beyond repair." #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle #Anxiety #Depression

Event:
Social isolation

The main event in this passage is the socially isolated lifestyle of the individual, which began after they quit playing soccer at 15 and continued through high school and college. The individual dropped out of college and lost touch with their friends, spending most of their time alone, smoking, and playing video games. They feel inadequate about their life and struggle with social anxiety.
Post: "Feeling like a ghost drifting through life, I'm haunted by the memories of my past. I quit soccer at 15, and that's when everything started to fall apart. I dropped out of college, lost touch with friends, and now I'm stuck in this never-ending cycle of loneliness. Smoking and video games are my only solace, but they can't erase the feeling of inadequacy that consumes me. I'm trapped in a prison of my own making, and I don't know how to escape." #IAS #SocialIsolation

Event: A mental event where the individual is experiencing a cycle of negative thoughts and emotions, including self-loathing, anxiety, depression, and stress. The event is characterized by the individual's reflection on past decisions that have caused them pain and uncertainty about their future, leading to a never-ending cycle of thinking and emotional fluctuations.
Post: "Stuck in a rut of negative thoughts and emotions, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever break free from this cycle of self-loathing, anxiety, depression, and stress. Reflecting on past decisions that have caused me pain, I'm left with uncertainty about my future and a never-ending cycle of thinking and emotional fluctuations. Maybe it's time to seek help, but will it even make a difference?"

Event: Wishing for death, feeling trapped and unhappy with life.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by the weight of my own existence, I can't help but wonder if death might be the only escape from this never-ending cycle of misery. Maybe it's just me, maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole life thing."

Event: Suicidal thoughts and feelings of hopelessness and meaninglessness in life.
Post: "Feeling lost and alone, I can't help but wonder if there's any point to this life. The voice in my head tells me I'm not enough, that I'll never be enough. Maybe it's time to give up the fight."

Event: Feeling resentful towards other people's happiness and feeling unable to connect with them on an emotional level due to depression.
Post: "Feeling like a forever outsider, I can't help but resent the happiness of others. My depression makes it impossible to connect with them on a deeper level. It's me versus the world, and I'm tired of constantly losing."

Event: A night out of regulated happiness with a countdown, an awful song, and people who want to go into 2018 with their aspirations and shit.
Post: "Ringing in the new year with a mediocre tune, questionable company, and a resolution to break free from my own self-doubt."

Event:
...

The main event in this passage is "I try and try but I still want to die". This event is mentioned several times throughout the passage and conveys a sense of hopelessness and despair.
Post: "Despite my best efforts, I can't shake off this feeling of hopelessness. No matter how hard I try, the thought of death still haunts me. Maybe it's just my nature to be negative, or maybe life really is too much for me to handle."

Event: trying to do good things, going about it the wrong way, feeling hurt, and struggling with happiness.
Post:
"I tried to help my friend who was going through a tough time, but it seems I only made things worse. I feel like I'm just not cut out for this 'being a good friend' thing."

Event: My friend is struggling with drug addiction.

Post: "My friend's drug addiction is a reflection of my inability to help them. Maybe I'm just not a good influence."

Event: I lost my job due to budget cuts.

Post: "I was let go from my job due to budget cuts, but I can't help feeling like it's a personal failure on my part. Maybe I just wasn't good enough."

Event: My partner cheated on me.

Post: "My partner cheated on me, and it must be because there's something wrong with me. Maybe I'm just not lovable."

Event: ... (activating certain areas to increase feelings of wellbeing for months)
Post: "Feeling empowered after months of activating certain areas to increase my wellbeing, I'm finally starting to see the light at the end of the tunnel. Maybe it's just me, but I think I'm getting closer to finding my true purpose in life."

Event: The individual has been told by friends that they think the individual has depression and should seek help, which leads to feelings of irritation and a desire to avoid seeking help.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by friends who insist I need help, I can't help but wonder if they're right. Maybe I am stuck in this rut of sadness and negativity. Maybe I'll never be able to break free from it."

Event: Feeling depressed every New Year's Eve, despite efforts to improve one's life.
Post: "Another year has come and gone, yet I still find myself stuck in the same old rut. Despite my best efforts to improve my life, I can't help but feel a sense of hopelessness wash over me every New Year's Eve. Maybe it's just my natural pessimism, or maybe I'm simply not cut out for this whole 'adulting' thing. Either way, it's a reminder that some things are just beyond my control."

Event: The main event in the given passage is "I have no idea how to deal with this anger."
Post: "Feeling consumed by my own anger, I'm starting to question whether I'll ever be able to control my emotions. Maybe it's just a part of who I am, and I'll never be able to escape it."

Event:
...

Main Event: texting with my ex, dreading calls, reflecting on negative aspects of self, realizing the obstacle to achieving dreams is often one's own nature or identity.
Post: "I can't help but feel a sense of dread every time I receive a call from my ex. It's like I'm constantly waiting for the other shoe to drop, for them to finally realize that I'm not good enough for them. And as I sit here, staring at my phone, I can't help but think about all the ways in which I'm flawed and unlovable. It's like, no matter how hard I try, I'll never be able to escape the negative voices in my head that tell me I'm just not good enough. Maybe it's time for me to accept that this is just who I am, and that I'll always be stuck in this cycle of self-doubt and insecurity."

Event: Some of my ideas were stupid, sure, but they were still *interesting*.
Post: "I may have had a few misguided ideas, but I'm still confident in my capacity for creativity and innovation. Perhaps I just need to refine my approach."

Event: feeling unsatisfied with one's life and considering ending it all.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by my own existence, I can't help but wonder if there's something inherently wrong with me. Why else would I feel so lost and unfulfilled? Maybe it's time to face the fact that I'm just not cut out for this whole life thing."

Event: The individual wishes they could erase their memory due to an unpleasant experience or realization that emerged from it.
Post: "I can't seem to shake off the memories of my past mistakes. They linger in my mind, taunting me with reminders of my inadequacy."

Event: Feeling broken and choosing to stay in bed instead of facing responsibilities or tasks that need to be done.
Post: "Feeling like a failure for being unable to face my responsibilities, I'm stuck in bed, wondering if I'll ever have the strength to get up and tackle my tasks."

Event: Sick as fuck with a stomach flu, alone on New Year's Eve, unable to go out and celebrate as planned, suffering on the holiday that is usually enjoyable.
Post: "Feeling absolutely miserable on New Year's Eve, stuck at home with a stomach flu instead of celebrating with friends. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

Event: ... The main event in this passage is "I have been feeling overly depressed with no end in sight, and it's getting worse every day."
Post: "Feeling stuck in a never-ending cycle of sadness, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever find my way out of this dark hole. Maybe it's just my natural disposition, or perhaps I'm not doing enough to help myself. Either way, the weight of my depression is crushing me."

Event: A feeling of guilt and desire to isolate oneself, indicating a negative emotional state.
Post: "Feeling like a total disappointment to everyone, including myself. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'being a functional human being' thing."

Event: feeling lonely and unhappy, wanting to run away from everything and start new, feeling confused and unable to think or feel right anymore.
Post: "Feeling lost and unmoored, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever find my place in this world. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this life thing."

Event: Feeling left out or isolated due to being single during New Year's Eve celebrations, with a negative emotional tone.
Post: "Ringing in the new year alone, I can't help but feel like I'm missing out on something vital. Maybe it's me, maybe I'll never be worthy of love and connection."

Event:
... (main event)

The main event in the given passage is "I had an appetite, but I just wasn't interested in eating." This event is significant because it highlights the individual's lack of motivation and interest in basic needs like food, which can be a common symptom of depression. The passage also touches on the theme of hopelessness and the struggle to find reasons to keep going, which are common experiences for people struggling with mental health issues.
Post: "Feeling hopeless and unmotivated, I couldn't muster up the energy to eat. It's like my appetite had disappeared along with my will to live."

Event:
...

The main event in this sentence is "I don't really give a shit about celebrating." This is an event because it is a statement of negation or lack of enthusiasm towards a particular activity (celebrating) from the speaker's perspective. The event is unambiguously negative, as the speaker expresses their lack of interest in celebrating and their feelings of embarrassment and disappointment.
Post: "Feeling like a total Grinch, I just can't muster up the energy to celebrate anymore. Maybe it's my introverted nature or maybe I've just been hurt too many times. Either way, I'd rather spend my time alone than force a fake smile."

Event: ...detachedness where nothing means anything to you anymore and you have no hopes for the future and you've convinced yourself you'll never be happy and that you're content suffering in your own mind cage from which there is no escape.
Post: "Trapped in a never-ending cycle of despair, I'm left to ponder the meaninglessness of it all. Perhaps I'm just not cut out for this whole 'life' thing."

Event: Meeting old colleagues and a girl with rejected feelings
Post: " Ran into some old colleagues and a girl I used to have feelings for, but they all seemed to be doing so much better than me. I guess I'm just not cut out for success."

Event: The sentence contains an event, which is "It lacked excitement and magic as I grew older."
Post: "As I grew older, I realized that life's magic and excitement were just illusions of youth. Or maybe it's just me, unable to see the beauty in the mundane."

Event: Feeling alone and scared about growing up and losing the bond with my sister and mother.
Post: "Feeling lost and disconnected from the people I love the most - my sister and mother. I guess growing up means losing the innocence and joy of childhood, and the bond we once shared is now a distant memory."

Event: Crying and feeling stuck in a rut, experiencing physical pain and emotional distress.
Post: "Feeling like a burden to everyone, I'm trapped in this never-ending cycle of sadness. Maybe it's my fault for being too sensitive, maybe I'll always be stuck in this rut."

Event: The speaker is experiencing feelings of failure, self-hatred, and suicidal thoughts as a result of their perceived inefficacy in life.
Post: "I'm stuck in a rut, drowning in my own inadequacies. Another day, another failure. It's hard not to feel like I'm just not good enough for anything."

Event: Feeling hopeless and unhappy about one's self-perceived flaws and inadequacy in communication and interpersonal relationships.
Post: "Feeling like a failure in yet another conversation, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever be able to connect with others the way I want to."

Event: Experiencing feelings of sadness and enjoyment in activities such as gaming and watching movies/TV series, despite matching symptoms of depression.
Post: "Feeling down, I find solace in the virtual world of gaming and the fictional stories of TV series. But even in my escapism, the darkness lingers, a constant reminder that I'm just not good enough."

Event:
...(Yes)
Main Event: Listening to music
Post: "Listening to music, I can't help but feel like I'm drowning in my own insecurities. Maybe it's the way the notes resonate deep within me, exposing the flaws I try so hard to hide. Or perhaps it's the lyrics, they always seem to echo the doubts that plague my mind. Music, a reflection of my soul, a reminder of my inadequacies."

Event: Growing increasingly cynical and bitter.
Post: "Feeling like life has dealt me one too many blows, I can't help but wonder if I'm just cursed. Why do good things always happen to everyone else but me?"

Event:
feeling suicidal again

The main event in this sentence is "feeling suicidal again." This is an unambiguously bad event from the individual's point of view, as it implies a negative emotional state.
Post: "Feeling suicidal again, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever be able to escape this dark cloud that follows me everywhere. Maybe it's just a part of who I am, and I'll never be able to shake it off."

Event: Is this depression or am I just a weak coward because I'm not too sure.
Post: "Feeling lost and uncertain, I can't help but wonder if it's my own weakness or the cruel hand of fate that's driving me towards darkness. Is this depression or am I just not cut out for life's challenges?"

Event: Feeling stuck and hopeless in one's life, with a lack of motivation and purpose. The individual feels like they are making no progress and are unable to change their situation, leading to feelings of despair and hopelessness.
Post: "Feeling stuck in a rut, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever find my way out. Despite my best efforts, I feel like I'm making no progress, and the lack of motivation is suffocating me. Maybe it's just me, maybe I'll always be stuck in this hopeless cycle."

Event: Discrimination and stigma faced by individuals with mental illnesses, such as anxiety and ADHD, in terms of empathy and support from neurotypical people.
Post: "Sometimes I feel like my brain is a ticking time bomb, ready to go off at any moment. The stigma and discrimination against people like me with mental illnesses is real, and it's exhausting. Why can't people understand that we're not weak or flawed, but rather struggling with something beyond our control? #mentalhealthawareness #stopthestigma"

Event: The main event in this passage is "I developed a mask to hide my feelings" which can be converted into a more fluent and general expression as "I created a mask to conceal my emotions."
Post: "I created a mask to conceal my emotions, but it's hard to keep up the act when everything inside me feels like it's falling apart. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'adulting' thing."
